## TableCollection.scan() method

Direct passthrough to table scan, but using provided indices if present. This lets us create collections that are a "view" over the top of a larger table. Arquero doesn't support the notion of iterating groups directly, so this provides that.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
scan(callback: (row?: number | undefined, data?: TableData | any[] | undefined, stop?: (() => void) | undefined) => void, ordered?: boolean): void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  callback | (row?: number \| undefined, data?: TableData \| any\[\] \| undefined, stop?: (() =&gt; void) \| undefined) =&gt; void | function to apply to each table row |
|  ordered | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> whether to scan according to orderby index underlying table |

<b>Returns:</b>

void
